programme.title: Beachfront Bargain Hunt: Renovation
programme.desc: Adrienne and Steve are seeking a vacation home in St. Joe Beach, Fla.; they find a house with potential, but it needs extensive renovations; unforeseen structural issues and budget concerns threaten to throw a wrench in their plans.

programme.title: Beachfront Bargain Hunt: Renovation
programme.desc: Vicky and Rome are looking to trade in the hustle and bustle of life in New York for the sun and surf of Flagler Beach, Fla.; they find an oceanfront property perfect for their new lifestyle, but it's in need of a major overhaul.

programme.title: Building Off the Grid
programme.desc: An eclectic builder is ready to take on his next challenge of constructing a Greek cottage in the East Tennessee Valley; when turbulent weather turns his build site into a mud pit, he questions whether or not his vision will ever become a reality.

programme.title: Beachfront Bargain Hunt: Renovation
programme.desc: After a recent medical scare, Nicole is ready to live life to the fullest in a home by the water in Moorehead City, N.C.; a tight budget and unforeseen problems might put a hiccup in her plan for the perfect beach retreat.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: While working on a French chateau, Tamara overhauls a master suite covered in the tackiest wallpaper she's ever ripped out of a home; to preserve a backyard kitchenette and cobblestone pavers, Tamara will be forced to make budget-wrecking decisions.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara seeks to transform a multi-family 1892 brick Craftsman into a single-family dwelling while keeping its original details; she and her father attempt to recover a vintage pocket door trapped inside a wall and update the home's electricity.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara continues working on an 1892 Craftsman and struggles to add a master bathroom; then, she finds a way to reuse floor boards as a porch swing, but her plan to reuse a claw-foot bathtub hits a snag because of a narrow doorway.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara Day works on restoring a 1909 Craftsman home, opening up its meandering layout and ripping out the tacky additions that have stripped the house of its original charm; she saves vintage light switches and a wallpaper mural.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara continues renovating a 1909 Craftsman home, transforming a small bedroom into the master bath; she refurbishes French doors, vintage sinks and a tub; during the walk-through, Tamara discovers the creepiest thing she's ever found in a home.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara annexes an oversized dining room to enlarge a tiny kitchen in a 1926 English Tudor; she rips out a tacky mantel to create a stunning fireplace surround; using a piece of reclaimed walnut, she creates a large desktop for an in-home office.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions
programme.desc: Tamara Day struggles to create a more spacious master suite until deciding to add a second deck to a 1926 English Tudor; Tamara strips off numerous coats of paint to restore original doors; she adds an outdoor living area with a fire pit.

programme.title: Bargain Mansions

programme.title: Earth: The Nature of Our Planet
programme.desc: A miraculous mantle envelops the entire planet - a thin skin of gasses called 'air'. Without it, there would be no life or weather, no habitable conditions, or protection from lethal ultraviolet radiation or meteorites from outer space. Explore the endless expanse of the invisible element - Air.

programme.title: Earth: The Nature of Our Planet
programme.desc: It's the solid crust of our planet, the perfect element in which to record the stories of deep time and of lifetimes. Change and progression is the way of earth. Air and water turn solid rock into soil. Animals walk upon that soil and are supported by it; but plants turn soil into life. We learn how they can feed themselves and the whole chain of animal life, in the realm of Land.

programme.title: Earth: The Nature of Our Planet

programme.desc: Kodiak Island is an unforgiving location with monster brown bear. This episode Melissa & her husband Ben take on all the elements during a hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: In Fisherman TV
programme.desc: It's freshwater fishing action in overdrive, with emphasis on top tactical maneuvers and precision lure presentation, as the In-Fisherman staff casts big baits for night-prowling walleyes.

programme.title: Sweetwater
programme.desc: Joey Nania relives his Bassmaster Open victory on Pickwick Lake with co-host Miles Burghoff.

programme.title: Trophy Pond
programme.sub-title: That Four-Acre Pond in Middle Tennessee

programme.title: MOJO TV
programme.desc: The guys are back at it in Tamaulipas, Mexico with Steve McCain Jr and Wide Open Outfitters. Whether it's a frantic paced hunt on the Laguna Madre or a fresh water pond beat down, Steve always has the guys on the X and guns blazing.

programme.title: Ducks Unlimited TV
programme.desc: This week DU TV co-host Fred Zink joins DU volunteers in Oklahoma, a fast-emerging hot spot for waterfowl hunting. This hunt features the Oklahoma state chairman and select volunteers from the Perry DU chapter.

programme.title: Backwoods Life
programme.desc: The Backwoods Life team is in Wisconsin with good friend Jarrod Washburn. There's snow on the ground and freezing temps, but the deer hunting is hot. Even these southern boys aren't whining about the weather.

programme.title: North American Whitetail
programme.desc: Blake Garlock tries his luck during gun season at Ken Tenn Hunting with Larry and Tyler Porter. Dr. James Kroll discusses late season hunting strategies for rut-worn bucks. Haynes Shelton profiles the C.W. Shelton buck from Kentucky.

programme.title: Steve's Outdoor Adventures
programme.desc: Travis Price travels to Alaska on his first Alaska grizzly bear hunt during the fall season.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's India
programme.desc: Joanna's explores Rajasthan, Delhi, and the mountainous North West ending in Kashmir, the place of her birth. She re-visits her modelling past by attending a photo shoot with Indian models and has a personal meeting with the Dalai Lama.

programme.desc: Simon and the team are in Herefordshire to meet new parents Cheryl and Bill. The couple enlist the help of Simon and the gang to get their chalet on a hill from "flat pack" to "Scandi chic".

programme.title: Becoming Orangutan
programme.desc: Experience a roller coaster of emotions and growing pains as the sanctuary's orangutans move through six grades toward their release into the wild. Discover how Dilla's fate suddenly changes, and watch as big boy Beni goes on an unwelcome diet.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: In the early months of the year, the Earth's axial tilt brings the height of summer in some places and the depths of winter in others. See how life struggles to survive under these extreme conditions.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: It's a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the largest sand island on earth, and home to wild dingoes, six-foot sand-worms, and eucalyptus woodlands. Find out how everything lives happily together in a complex ecosystem built entirely upon sand.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: The beaches of California are some of the most beautiful in the world, but are they falling out of balance due to mankind's effects on nature? What does it take for the magnificent fauna of the Pacific Coast to keep living... on the "living beach"?

programme.title: Becoming Orangutan
programme.desc: Experience a roller coaster of emotions and growing pains as the sanctuary's orangutans move through six grades toward their release into the wild. Discover how Dilla's fate suddenly changes, and watch as big boy Beni goes on an unwelcome diet.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: In the early months of the year, the Earth's axial tilt brings the height of summer in some places and the depths of winter in others. See how life struggles to survive under these extreme conditions.

programme.title: The Big Dry
programme.desc: The rains are late. It is the most brutal time of year. Babies born into drought face starvation. Everything is desperate for rain. When it arrives, it is a downpour on an enormous scale. Alien creatures emerge into a different world. The wet season begins.

programme.title: Seasons of the Wild
programme.desc: In Southern Florida, a unique and complex ecosystem known as the Everglades has entered its winter season. Predator and prey are forced to live in close proximity due to a limited supply of water.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: It's Halifax through the eyes of its wildest residents. During the day, squirrels and chipmunks compete for territory in the city park. At night, Halifax's raccoons invade backyards and seagulls scour the streets for pizza.

programme.title: Into the Wild Colombia
programme.desc: This is the story of Julieta, a female golden dart frog, in search of her Romeo. She's about to lay her eggs and must find a male to fertilize them. Romeo's calls guide her through the forest, but crossing the dense rainforest is no easy feat.

programme.title: Waterworld Africa
programme.desc: Nestled on the western coast of South Africa lies an extraordinary cove that is host to an abundance of marine and bird life. It provides ample food and spurs a life cycle that reaches well beyond Africa. This is the Blue Lagoon.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Cape Breton Highlands National Park was established to protect the primeval forest from clear-cutting - but today the park faces a new threat. Moose, beavers and moths have combined to decimate large sections of the Boreal and Acadian woodlands.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: It's a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the largest sand island on earth, and home to wild dingoes, six-foot sand-worms, and eucalyptus woodlands. Find out how everything lives happily together in a complex ecosystem built entirely upon sand.

programme.title: Seasons of the Wild
programme.desc: In Southern Florida, a unique and complex ecosystem known as the Everglades has entered its winter season. Predator and prey are forced to live in close proximity due to a limited supply of water.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Wild Wild East's wetland habitats are at risk. These marshes and bogs are the ancient home of the endangered Blanding's Turtle. But each fall new turtles spring from the lake shores of Nova Scotia. If the vulnerable Blanding's can make it through their first few years of life, they'll live for almost a century. But saving the turtle means protecting the wetlands, and all the other amphibians and reptiles that call the slow-moving waters home.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: The relationships between species like lobsters, scallops and crabs are numerous and complicated. Changing water temperature is bringing invasive species to the Wild Wild East, putting pressure on the species humans count on for important commercial harvests.

programme.title: Animal Empires
programme.desc: Every empire needs a succession plan. Making babies - and raising them - is crucial for every species to survive. In some social circles, it takes a village to raise a family. In others, a single parent is all that stands between the vulnerability of youth and the threats of the wild.

programme.title: Waterworld Africa
programme.desc: Deep in southern Africa, a mighty river snakes through untamed wilderness. Its vast flood plains are a magnet for wildlife. In the dry season animals travel great distances to reach this oasis and during droughts space and resources are at a premium. But every animal has its place along the banks of the mighty Chobe river...

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: This episode of Amazing Animal Friends features a duck that won't go in the water without a ride from her pooch pal, an elephant that thinks she's a buffalo, and a herd of cows that adopt an orphaned deer.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: Travel around the globe to witness the atmospheric shifts that take place in March, from the wave of cherry blossoms that unfold across Japan to the final raft of green sea turtles that arrive on the Great Barrier Reef islands to lay eggs.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Watch as the Lilongwe Wildlife team try to release two serval cats into the wild. One escapes and returns injured. Will their release be successful? A new baby vervet arrives in critical condition, and a giant owl flies to freedom.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join Amanda on a white knuckle bush-whacking adventure to rescue a waterbuck caught by a poacher's snare. Meanwhile, the center's resident hyena is treated for flea bitten ears and Alma gets a mysterious late night monkey delivery.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: In the Northern Atlantic, cold Canadian waters surround eight European Islands. This is the last remaining overseas territory of France, and the summer-home to a semi-feral population of horses and ponies. Wild Wild East infiltrates the herd to explore the politics and power of horses. Meanwhile, in the waters surrounding the French archipelago, the once-vast stocks of cod fish are disappearing, changing life above the surface for humans and horses.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Non-native species have made their way into the Wild Wild East and staked their claim to the jagged coast. At White Point Beach Resort in Liverpool, Nova Scotia bunnies have hopped on in for an extended holiday. It's turf wars between the beachcombers and the chalets dwellers. Meanwhile, the starling population is beginning to rival gulls and pigeons.

programme.title: Animal Empires
programme.desc: Over the course of recorded time, many species have been threatened with extinction. Once-powerful animal empires - like the dinosaurs - have been completely wiped from the planet. But others once on the verge of disappearance have survived, bounced back, and even reclaimed their kingdoms.

programme.title: Waterworld Africa
programme.desc: All rivers are on a quest, a constant mission to find the ocean, an endless cycle to move water across the vast blue planet. Along the way they support countless lives but their odyssey is by no means easy. From ice to heat, obstacles abound. Yet, despite an ever-changing nature, a river always finds its way - on the journey from Source to Sea.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Meet more Amazing Animal Friends including Charlotte, a schnauzer who enjoys bath time with her guinea pig pal Wallace, and a randy ram called Hamish who likes to sneak off to live with a herd of dairy cows instead of his own kind.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: Watch summer unfold in the Northern Hemisphere, while regions close to the equator enter the wet season and Southern Africa goes dry, creating scarcity for some creatures and bounty for others.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Watch as the Lilongwe Wildlife team try to release two serval cats into the wild. One escapes and returns injured. Will their release be successful? A new baby vervet arrives in critical condition, and a giant owl flies to freedom.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: Watch summer unfold in the Northern Hemisphere, while regions close to the equator enter the wet season and Southern Africa goes dry, creating scarcity for some creatures and bounty for others.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Be an eyewitness to the death and resurrection that winter brings to Africa. Observe what comes with shorter days, from drought conditions to frigid winds, and marvel at the survival skills of animals and plants as they face the season's fury.

programme.title: The Great Elephant Tale
programme.desc: Follow the adventures of three elephants across three very distinct African habitats. Their travels combine to tell the story of how these emotional and intelligent creatures evolved over millions of years to survive on the continent.

Meanwhile, the starling population is beginning to rival gulls and pigeons.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Watch as the Lilongwe Wildlife team try to release two serval cats into the wild. One escapes and returns injured. Will their release be successful? A new baby vervet arrives in critical condition, and a giant owl flies to freedom.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join Amanda on a white knuckle bush-whacking adventure to rescue a waterbuck caught by a poacher's snare. Meanwhile, the center's resident hyena is treated for flea bitten ears and Alma gets a mysterious late night monkey delivery.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Meet more Amazing Animal Friends including Charlotte, a schnauzer who enjoys bath time with her guinea pig pal Wallace, and a randy ram called Hamish who likes to sneak off to live with a herd of dairy cows instead of his own kind.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: Watch summer unfold in the Northern Hemisphere, while regions close to the equator enter the wet season and Southern Africa goes dry, creating scarcity for some creatures and bounty for others.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Be an eyewitness to the death and resurrection that winter brings to Africa. Observe what comes with shorter days, from drought conditions to frigid winds, and marvel at the survival skills of animals and plants as they face the season's fury.

programme.title: The Great Elephant Tale
programme.desc: Follow the adventures of three elephants across three very distinct African habitats. Their travels combine to tell the story of how these emotional and intelligent creatures evolved over millions of years to survive on the continent.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Wild Wild East travels through time and space to show what one-year - and four seasons - looks like for the wildest animals of Canada's East-Coast.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: In Hampton, New Brunswick the deer population is running wild. In the summer locals struggle to maintain their crops from growing fawns and hungry does. Sightings have reached an all time high and residents fear the overpopulation may be at its tipping point.

programme.title: Great Parks of Africa
programme.desc: The Addo Elephant National Park sits in the heart of the Eastern Cape of South Africa, covering over 1600 square kilometres of land. While the elephants are the stars of the park, Addo is the only reserve in the world where visitors can see all of the "big seven": lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo, white rhino, southern right whale, and great white shark.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: At the water's edge a brave group of male penguins gather, preparing to make the dangerous journey ashore. With many threats ahead, there is safety in number and these petite penguins have important business to attend. It's time to breed and they must find a burrow before the females arrive.
